conclusion: Determine the power dissipated in the resistor R.
Conductor rod is moving with a speed v in a magnetic field B vertically downward.
Induced emf in the conductor rod is B * v * d.
Induced emf is shared between resistor R and internal resistance r of conductor rod.
Current I in the circuit is B * v * d / (R + r).
Force exerted by magnetic field on conductor rod is given by Lorentz force law.
Magnetic force F_B is B^2 * v * d^2 / (R + r).
Frictional force F_f is given by mu * normal force.
Frictional force F_f is mu * mg.
Net force on conductor rod is difference between external force F and sum of magnetic force and frictional force.
Net force is zero, so F = F_B + F_f = B^2 * v * d^2 / (R + r) + mu * mg.
Power dissipated in resistor R is given by I^2 * R.
Power dissipated in resistor R is B^2 * v^2 * d^2 * R / (R + r)^2.
